goal: Create a simple Node.js CLI tool that wraps the TypeScript scanner for command-line usage, allowing users to scan projects without opening the Dashboard UI.
requirements: CLI executable that accepts project path as argument
Prints scan results to stdout (element count, file count, duration)
Simple error handling for invalid paths or scan failures
Usage documentation (USAGE.md) following same format as setup_coderef_dirs.py docs
constraints: Must use existing TypeScript scanner (no duplication)
Keep it simple - under 50 lines of code
Must work from any directory (not just coderef-dashboard root)

architecture.implementation: Node.js script that imports scanner, accepts CLI args, runs scan, prints results

tasks.title: Create scan.js wrapper script
tasks.description: Node.js script that imports scanner from @coderef/core and runs it with CLI arguments
acceptance_criteria: Accepts project path as first argument
Validates path exists and is directory
Prints results: element count, file count, duration
Handles errors gracefully (path not found, scan failed)

tasks.title: Add CLI argument parsing
tasks.description: Parse command line arguments for project path and optional flags

tasks.title: Create USAGE.md documentation
tasks.description: Simple usage instructions following same format as setup_coderef_dirs.py USAGE.md
acceptance_criteria: Usage section with 2-3 examples (current dir, full path)
What Gets Returned section (element count, file count, timing)

tasks.title: Create REFERENCE.md quick reference sheet
tasks.description: One-page quick reference for command syntax, options, and output format
acceptance_criteria: Output format reference (what each line means)

tasks.title: Test CLI with real projects
tasks.description: Manual testing with dashboard project and games project
acceptance_criteria: Scan games project: Returns element count successfully
Current directory usage works: node scan.js .
Full path usage works: node scan.js C:\path\to\project
Error handling works: Invalid path shows clear error

implementation_notes.output_format: Simple text output, not JSON (easier to read in terminal)
implementation_notes.error_handling: Try/catch around scan, print error message to stderr
implementation_notes.path_handling: Use path.resolve() to handle both relative and absolute paths

success_criteria: CLI script executes successfully: node scan.js <path>
Returns accurate scan results matching UI scanner output
USAGE.md is clear and concise (under 50 lines)
Error messages are helpful (not cryptic stack traces)
Works from any directory (not tied to coderef-dashboard location)
